[1]Hey, there. I'm Chris Parker. The new president of Southwest Bank. Just wanted to come by and personally introduce myself to every branch manager.

[3]Carl Kendall? I'm Chris Parker. President of Southwest Bank.

[6]Which is when I got the numbers from your loan desk.

[12]You're the kind of person we want in corporate. We're taking some clients on a golfing trip. You golf?

[20]You're a funny one, Carl Kendall. Remember, they have to win. In Asian cultures, there's a concept called Saving Face. You have to let them win. But if they smell for a second that you haven't tried your hardest, they'll commit hari kari. 
[21]Who knows? It's a delicate balance, Kendall. Like two little girls on a see saw with a crocodile beneath them. Make the wrong move, and the little girl will end up in the croc's maw. 
[22]Alright, buddy. It's all you. 
[23]You must have quite a powerful stroke. 
[24]What was that? 
[25]I bogied the fifth hole.   I'm still pissed about that.

[26]Of course, of course!      Please come in!

[29]Outstanding, Carl. Except for one

Perhaps that would have been the most delicious cup of coffee you would have ever had. Who's to say? Not you, Carl, because you said no! Anyone can quit smoking for a day. But for a lifetime? No. 
[31]Behold, Carl, -- the Maniyesto.
